SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Sub.: Board meeting ￂﾖ Un-audited Financial Results for the quarter and half-year ended September 30, 2018 Dear Sir, The Board of Directors has today approved the Un-Audited (Consolidated & Standalone) Financial results of the Company for the quarter and half-year ended September 30, 2018. The Financial Results under Regulation 33 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 are enclosed at Annexure- A. The Limited Review Report of the Statutory Auditors on the aforesaid Financial results under Regulation 33 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 is enclosed at Annexure- B. The Board of Directors has declared an Interim Dividend of Rs. 2/- per equity share of Rs. 2/- each of the Company for the Financial Year 2018-19. The Record date of October 31, 2018 fixed for the payment of the aforesaid interim dividend has been confirmed by the Board of Directors. The payment date of the said interim dividend shall be November 11, 2018. An Investor Release dated October 23, 2018 on the financial results is enclosed at Annexure- C. The Board of Directors has appointed Ms. Roshni Nadar Malhotra as the Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company with effect from October 22, 2018. She continues to be the Non-Executive Director of the Company.  This is for your information and records.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Sub.: Board meeting ￂﾖ Un-audited Financial Results for the quarter ended June 30, 2018 Dear Sir, The Board of Directors has today approved the Un-Audited (Consolidated & Standalone) Financial results of the Company for the quarter ended June 30, 2018. The Financial Results under Regulation 33 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 are enclosed at Annexure- A. The Limited Review Report of the Statutory Auditors on the aforesaid Financial results under Regulation 33 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 is enclosed at Annexure- B. The Board of Directors has declared an Interim Dividend of Rs.2/- per equity share of Rs.2/- each of the Company for the Financial Year 2018-19. The closure of Register of Members and Share Transfer Books from August 6, 2018 to August 6, 2018 (for one day only) fixed for the payment of the aforesaid interim dividend has been confirmed by the Board of Directors. The payment date of the said interim dividend shall be August 14, 2018. An Investor Release dated July 27, 2018 on the financial results is enclosed at Annexure- C. This is for your information and records.

SUBJECT: Shareholders meeting
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Notice of Postal BallotThis is in furtherance to our letter dated July 12, 2018, informing the Stock Exchanges about the approval of the Board of Directors of HCL Technologies Limited (the ￂﾓCompanyￂﾔ) for the proposed Buy-back of up to 3,63,63,636 fully paid up equity shares of the Company of face value of ₹2 each (the ￂﾓEquity Sharesￂﾔ) at a price of ₹1,100 per Equity Share payable in cash for an aggregate amount not exceeding ₹4,000 crores from the Equity Shareholders or beneficial owners of the Equity Shares of the Company on a proportionate basis, through the ￂﾓTender Offerￂﾔ route as prescribed under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy back of Securities) Regulations, 1998, as amended (the ￂﾓBuy-back Regulationsￂﾔ) using the ￂﾓMechanism for acquisition of shares through Stock Exchangeￂﾔ notified by the Securities and Exchange Board of India.Enclosed please find herewith the following documents:1. Copy of the Postal Ballot Notice dated July 14, 2018 and Postal Ballot Form, dispatched to the Members of the Company on July 17, 2018, who held the Equity Shares of the Company as at the close of business hours on Thursday, July 12, 2018, i.e. the cut-off date, for seeking their consent for the proposed Buy-back of Equity Shares by the Company.2. Copies of the newspaper advertisements confirming the completion of dispatch of the Postal Ballot Notice and Postal Ballot Form, published in the English and Hindi newspapers, namely the Mint (All Editions) and the Hindustan (Delhi Edition) respectively on July 18, 2018.The above documents are also available on the website of the Company at https://www.hcltech.com/investors.The Company has engaged the services of National Securities Depository Limited for providing remote e-voting facility to its Members to enable them to cast their votes electronically. The voting through physical ballot and remote e-voting will commence from Wednesday, July 18, 2018 at 9:00 A.M. (IST) and shall end on Thursday, August 16, 2018 at 5:00 P.M. (IST).Further, we would like to inform you that the Promoter Group has expressed its intention to participate in the proposed Buy-back of Equity Shares by the Company, the details of which are available in the enclosed Postal Ballot Notice.This is for your information and records.

SUBJECT: Buyback
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company, in its meeting held i.e. on July 12, 2018, have approved the Buy-back of up to 3,63,63,636 (Three Crores Sixty Three Lacs Sixty Three Thousand Six Hundred and Thirty Six) fully paid up equity shares of the Company of face value of Rs2 each (representing 2.61% of the fully paid-up equity shares of the Company outstanding as on March 31, 2018 and as on date) at a price of Rs.1,100 (Rupees One Thousand and One Hundred) per equity share payable in cash for an aggregate amount not exceeding Rs 4,000 crores (Rupees Four Thousand Crores only) (hereinafter referred to as the ("Buy-back Size") which is 14.83% and 11.59%, of the fully paid-up equity share capital and free reserves (including securities premium account) as per the latest audited standalone and consolidated financial statements of the Company, respectively, for the financial year ended March 31, 2018. The Buy-back Size does not include any expenses for the Buy-back like filing fees payable to the Securities and Exchange Board of India, advisors fees, public announcement publication expenses, printing and dispatch expenses, transaction costs viz. brokerage, applicable taxes such as securities transaction tax, service tax, stamp duty, etc.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Board meeting held on July 12, 2018. Subject: Outcome of Board Meeting pursuant to Regulation 30 of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 (ￂﾓLODR Regulationsￂﾔ) Further to our letter dated July 9, 2018, we wish to inform you that, the Board of Directors of the Company, in its meeting held today, i.e. on July 12, 2018, have approved the Buy-back of up to 3,63,63,636 (Three Crores Sixty Three Lacs Sixty Three Thousand Six Hundred and Thirty Six) fully paid up equity shares of the Company of face value of ₹2 each (representing 2.61% of the fully paid-up equity shares of the Company outstanding as on March 31, 2018 and as on date) at a price of ₹1,100 (Rupees One Thousand and One Hundred) per equity share payable in cash for an aggregate amount not exceeding ₹4,000 crores (Rupees Four Thousand Crores only) (hereinafter referred to as the ￂﾓBuy-back Sizeￂﾔ) which is 14.83% and 11.59%, of the fully paid-up equity share capital and free reserves (including securities premium account) as per the latest audited standalone and consolidated financial statements of the Company, respectively, for the financial year ended March 31, 2018. The Buy-back Size does not include any expenses for the Buy-back like filing fees payable to the Securities and Exchange Board of India, advisorsￂﾒ fees, public announcement publication expenses, printing and dispatch expenses, transaction costs viz. brokerage, applicable taxes such as securities transaction tax, service tax, stamp duty, etc. The Buy-back is proposed to be made from the shareholders of the Company on a proportionate basis, through the ￂﾓTender Offerￂﾔ route as prescribed under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy-back of Securities) Regulations, 1998, as amended (the ￂﾓBuy-back Regulationsￂﾔ) using the ￂﾓMechanism for acquisition of shares through Stock Exchangeￂﾔ notified by SEBI vide circular CIR/CFD/POLICYCELL/1/2015 dated April 13, 2015 read with circular CFD/DCR2/CIR/P/2016/131 dated December 09, 2016 and circular SEBI/HO/CFD/DIL1/CIR/P/2018/011 dated January 19, 2018 and or such other mechanism as may be applicable and in accordance with the Companies Act, 2013 and rules made thereunder. The Buy-back is subject to the approval of the shareholders by way of a special resolution through Postal Ballot and all other approvals as may be required. The pre Buy-back shareholding pattern of the Company is attached hereto as Annexure A. Further, the details of the actual number of equity shares bought back (including as a percentage of the existing paid-up capital) and the post Buy-back shareholding pattern are currently unavailable and will be provided on completion of the Buy-back. The public announcement setting out the process, timelines and other requisite details will be provided in due course subject to receipt of requisite approvals and in accordance with the Buy-back Regulations. We request you to take the above information on record.

The response from the Company is attached.

SUBJECT: Reply to Clarification Sought
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from HCL Technologies Limited with respect to announcement dated 27-Jun-2018, regarding a press release dated Jun 27, 2018, titled "HCL Acquires H&D International to Enhance Delivery Capabilities in Germany and Automotive Expertise Globally ". On basis of above the Company is required to clarify following: 1. Percentage of shareholding / control acquired and / or number of shares acquired; 2. Nature of consideration - whether cash consideration or share swap and details of the same; 3. Cost of acquisition or the price at which the shares are acquired; 4. Whether the acquisition would fall within related party transactions and whether the promoter/ promoter group/ group companies have any interest in the entity being acquired? If yes, nature of interest and details thereof and whether the same is done at "arm's length"; The response of the Company is attahed.

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS:
HCLTECH:The Exchange has sought clarification from HCL Technologies Limited with respect to announcement dated 27-Jun-2018, regarding " HCL Technologies Limited has informed the Exchange regarding a press release dated Jun 27, 2018, titled "HCL Acquires H&D International to Enhance Delivery Capabilities in Germany and Automotive Expertise Globally ".". On basis of above the Company is required to clarify following: 1. Percentage of shareholding / control acquired and / or number of shares acquired;
2. Nature of consideration - whether cash consideration or share swap and details of the same;
3. Cost of acquisition or the price at which the shares are acquired;
4. Whether the acquisition would fall within related party transactions and whether the promoter/ promoter group/ group companies have any interest in the entity being acquired? If yes, nature of interest and details thereof and whether the same is done at "arm's length";
The response of the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Limited has informed the Exchange that "MillerCoors, LLC, a client of Company has filed a lawsuit in the United States District Court for the Northern District of Illinois against the Company and HCL America Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company. MillerCoors allegations under the complaint is that HCL did not deliver an enterprise software project per the agreed timelines. This specific project started in December 2013 and ended in June 2016. The Company continue to have good business relationship with MillerCoors. We have other ongoing projects with MillerCoors running smoothly. We are in discussions with MillerCoors to resolve this matter amicably. The project in consideration has already ended and we are not expecting any adverse financial impact of the same for the quarter ending March 31, 2017."

SUBJECT: Buyback
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company, in its meeting held on March 20, 2017, have approved the Buyback of up to 3,50,00,000 (Three crores fifty lacs) fully paid up Equity Shares of the Company of face value of Rs. 2 each (representing 2.48 % and 2.45 % of the fully paid-up equity shares of the Company outstanding as on March 31, 2016 and as on date respectively) at a price of Rs.1,000 (Rupees One thousand only) per Equity Share payable in cash for an aggregate amount not exceeding Rs.3,500 crores (Rupees Three thousand five hundred crores only) (hereinafter referred to as the "Buyback size") which is 16.39% and 13.62%, of the fully paid-up Equity Share capital and Free reserves (including Securities Premium Account) as per the latest audited standalone and consolidated balance sheet of the Company , respectively, for the financial year ended March 31, 2016. The Buyback size does not include any expenses for the Buyback like filing fees payable to the Securities and Exchange Board of India ("SEBI"), advisors' fees, public announcement publication expenses, printing and dispatch expenses, transaction costs viz. brokerage, applicable taxes such as securities transaction tax, service tax, stamp duty, etc. The Buyback is proposed to be made from the shareholders of the Company on a proportionate basis, through the 'Tender Offer" route as prescribed under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buyback of Securities) Regulations, 1998, as amended (the "Buyback Regulations") using the "Mechanism for acquisition of shares through Stock Exchange" notified by SEBI vide circular CIR/CFD/POLICYCELL/1/201 5 dated April 13, 2015 read with circular CFD/DCR2/CI R/P/2016/131 dated December 09, 2016 or such other mechanism as may be applicable and in accordance with the Companies Act, 2013 and rules made thereunder (the "Act") . The Buyback would be subject to approval of the shareholders by way of a special resolution through Postal Ballot and all other applicable statutory approvals.

DETAILS: HCL Technologies Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on October 19, 2015 :1. As per the Scheme, the India System Integration Business of the Company would be transferred to HCL Comnet Limited on a going concern basis with an objective to have simplified business structure with greater visibility in the performance of individual businesses. The said Scheme is subject to requisite approvals.(2) . SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that "TechM, HCL eye $350m stake in Geometric". The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the company. HCL Technologies Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "The Company, in the normal course of its business, evaluates businesses and opportunities in and outside India for inorganic growth. In the background, it is respectfully submitted that no event has occurred that has triggered an obligation for the Company to make a disclosure under Clause 36 of the Listing Agreement."

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from HCL Technologies Limited with respect to recent news item captioned "TechM, HCL eye $350m stake in Geometric". In this regard, Exchange have advised the Company to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following: a) Whether such event/negotiations/article stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company. b) Whether company are aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under clause 36 of the Listing Agreement. The response from the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that HCL Infosystems is in process to merge its system integration and services business with HCL Technology. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the company. HCL Technologies Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "No proposal to merge HCL Infosystems Limited or its systems integration and services business with HCL Technologies Limited is under consideration by the Board of HCL Technologies Limited. Both these entities have been teaming on specific opprtunities in India. In these cases they have been cross selling each other's services over the last 2 years. HCL Technolgies Limited derived about 5% of its revenue from India during FY 13. It is expected that the revenue from India during FY 14 would remain at similar level. The arrangement with HCL Infosystems Limited did not have any impact on the margins in the past; it is not expected to have any impact on the margins going forward."

SUBJECT: Release
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that "In accordance with Rule 8.4 of City Code on Takeovers and Mergers, UK, HCL EAS Limited, an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of HCL Technologies Limited announces that, on 3 November 2008, the Axon Group Plc. ("Axon") Directors (other than Mr Royston Hogarth) and a key employee of Axon entered into irrevocable undertakings with HCL EAS Limited pursuant to which each of them has irrevocably undertaken to vote (or procure the vote) in favour of the resolutions to be proposed at the HCL Meetings (or, in the event that the HCL Acquisition is implemented by way of a takeover offer, to accept or procure the acceptance of such offer) in respect of their entire beneficial holding of Axon Shares. Their beneficial holding is currently an aggregate of 147,420 Axon Shares, representing approximately 0.2 per cent, of the existing issued share capital of Axon (the "Undertakings"). The Undertakings remain binding even if a higher offer is made by a third party, but cease to be binding (a) on the withdrawal or lapse of the HCL Scheme, or (b) if the HCL Acquisition is implemented by way of a takeover offer, on such offer lapsing or being withdrawn". Further the Company has submitted to the Exchange a release regarding the Disclosure under City Code on Takeovers and Mergers, UK. A copy of release shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the announcement being issued by the Company through HCL EAS Limited, an indirect wholly owned subsidiary incorporated in the UK under rule 2.5 of the City code on Takeovers and Mergers, UK. Further, the company has informed the Exchange that: "The Board of HCL Technologies is pleased to announce the terms of a cash offer to be made by HCL EAS ( an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of HCL Technologies which has been formed specifically for the purposes of making the Offer) to acquire the entire issued and to be issued share capital of Axon. The Offer: Under the terms of the Offer, Axon Shareholders will receive for each Axon Share 650 pence in cash inclusive of the Interim Dividend. The Offer price values the entire issued and to be issued share capital of Axon at approximately Pound 441.1 million. The Offer price represents a premium of : 1) 42.6 per cent to the average Closing Price of 455.7 pence per Axon Share for the three months ended 22 August 2008, being the last business day prior to the announcement of the offer by Infosys for Axon; 2) 29.4 per cent to the Closing Price of 502.5 pence per Axon Share on 22 August 2008, being the last business day prior to the announcement of the offer by Infosys for Axon; and 3) 8.3 per cent to the Infosys offer of 600 pence per Axon Share, inclusive of the Interim Dividend". The copy of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company in its meeting held on August 01, 2008 has appointed Mr. Vineet Nayar, Chief Executive Officer of the Company as Wholetime Director of the Company with effect from August 01, 2008 for a period of 5 years. Mr. Vineet Nayar shall be designated as Chief Executive Officer & Wholetime Director. The appointment of Mr. Vineet Nayar as the Wholetime Director shall be subject to the approval by the shareholder in the Annual General Meeting of the Company. SUBJECT: Dividend/Book Closure/Date of AGM
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company in their meeting held on August 01, 2008 the Board has recommended a final dividend of Rs.3 per share (150% on an equity share of face value of Rs.2/-) for the year ended June 30, 2008 and the Board has fixed the date of Annual General Meeting on October 22, 2008. The Register of members and share transfer books of the Company shall be closed from October 23, 2008 to October 24, 2008 (both days inclusive) for the purpose of the Annual General meeting of the Company and for determining the shareholders who shall be entitled for payment of final dividend to be considered at the said meeting.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has given clarification on News Item -"HCL Tech may bag $200m outsourcing deal" news item appearing in the website(s) (like moneycontrol.com) and News Channel(s) (like CNBC TV18) and various calls received by the Company from the investors in this regard.  In this regard the company has informed the Exchange that "We wish to place on record that our Company, in line with its stated policy, does not respond to market rumours and hence we have no comments to offer in regard to the said news item. Further, at any point in time, the Company is in dialog with several prospective customers and it is highly prejudicial to our interest and indeed our customers interests to take cognizance of, and clarify, such speculative reports. Commenting on any such relationships would also infringe on confidentiality agreements / covenants entered into with such customers which prevent us from making any disclosures until we get the consent from our customers to make press releases on such contract wins".

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that HCL Technologies Ltd may acquire around 42% stake in Cambridge Solutions Limited. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. HCL Technologies Ltd has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "The Company (HCL) is looking at acquisition targets as continuous process in line with its growth strategy. HCL at any point of time would be evaluating quite a few inorganic opportunities. These targets are at various stages of evaluation. Any acquisition would be driven by either the need to fill in the capability gap in the software side, or to acquire a company in value BPO space provided that there is a potential to offshore. However, in none of the targets we have reached a stage where we have concluded either to acquire or not to acquire, or reached any binding agreement with the potential target. We wish to place on record that our Company, in line with its stated policy, does not comment on speculative reports or conjectures."

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that with reference to the news item "HCL Tech cute $ 780m outsourcing deal" which appeared in The Economic Times on July 07, 2006 and various calls received from the Investors by the Company on July 07, 2006. In this regard the Company has informed the Exchange that the Company was approached by the 'The Economic Times' to comment on the speculative report as published and the Company has requested them not to go by speculations and clearly stated that the Company does not comment on speculations. The Company would like to place to the record that the Company, in line with its stated policy, does not respond to market rumours and hence has no comments to offer in regard to the said news item. Further, at any point in time, HCL is in dialog with several prospective customers and it is highly prejudicial to Company's interest and indeed Company's customers' interests to tke cognizance of, and clarify, such speculative reports. Commenting on any such relationships would also infringe on confidentiality agreements / convenants entered into with such customers which prevent the Company from making any disclosure until the Company get the consent from the customers to make press releases on such contract wins. The Company further clarify that the last information released by the Company was on July 05, 2006 regarding allotment of shares under Stock Option Plans of the Company and since then, the Company has not made any announcement nor issued any press release.

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that HCL Technologies Ltd has bagged $780 million outsourcing deal from Skandia. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. HCL Technologies Ltd has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "We would like to place on record that our Company, in line with its stated policy, does not respond to market rumours and hence has no comments to offer in regard to the said news item. Further, at any point in time, HCL is in dialog with several prospective customers and it is highly prejudicial to our interest and indeed our customers' interests to take cognizance of, and clarify, such speculative reports. Commenting on any such relationships would also infringe on confidentiality agreements/covenants entered into with such customers which prevent us from making any disclosures until we get the consent from our customers to make press releases on such contract wins."

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Scheme of Amalgamation of HCL Technologies (Mumbai) Ltd., HCL Technologies BPO Services Ltd., HCL Enterprise Solutions (India) Ltd, DSL Software Ltd., Shipara Technologies Ltd and Aquila Technologies Ltd., wholly - owned subsidiaries of HCL Technologies Ltd., with the Company has been approved by the Hon'ble High Courts of Delhi and Karnataka vide their order dated October 28, 2005 and December 16, 2005, respectively.  Further the Order of the Karnataka High Court, delivered to the Company on December 23, 2005, has been filed with the Registrar of Companies on January 18, 2006 and the Order of the Delhi High Court, delivered to the Company on March 07, 2006, has been filed with the Registrar of Companies on March 08, 2006.  Accordingly, with the completion of filings of the aforesaid orders with the Registrar of Companies, the Scheme has become effective retrospectively from the Appointed Date, i.e April 01, 2005.

SUBJECT: Clarification of News
DETAILS: Clarification of News : The media had reports on January 12, 2006 that HCL Technologies Ltd  is likely to bag 2 orders worth $ 250 million each from Dixons, UK in the infrastructure outsourcing space. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. HCL Technologies Ltd. has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "The news item seems to be speculative in nature. In this regard, we wish to place on record that our Company, in line with its stated policy, does not comment on speculative reports or conjectures. At any point in time, HCL is in dialog with several prospective customers and it is highly prejudicial to our interest and indeed our customers' interests to take cognizance of, and clarify, such speculative reports. Further, commenting on any such relationships would also infringe on confidentiality agreements/ covenants entered into with such customers which prevent us from making any disclosures until we get the consent from our customers to make press releases on such contract wins".

SUBJECT: Clarification of News

Adoption of Annual Accounts for the financial year ended June 30, 2005 together with the reports of the Directors and Auditors thereon.  2. Re-appointment of Mr. Subroto Bhattacharya as Director of the Company.  3. Re-appointment of Mr. Amal Ganguli as Director of the Company.  4. SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that with reference to the news item appearing in The Economic Times dated May 25, 2005 - 'HCL Tech to form JV with NEC Corp' and with reference to the various calls received from investors by the Company on May 25, 2005 in this regard, the Company has clarified as follows: "The Company continues to be in discussions on an ongoing basis with various companies across the world for finalizing business relationships. The Company has in the past spelt out its approach on undertaking a non-linear path for its business growth. This strategy has involved entering into JV's/alliances with companies or undertaking acquisitions, through out the world. In line with its approach, the Company continues to evaluate various options and opportunities as appropriate with its business requirements. The Company in line with its stated policy, does not respond to market rumours.  The Company has further clarified that the last information released by the Company was on May 19, 2005 regarding 'Allotment of Shares under ESOP' and since then the Company has not made any announcement nor issued any press release. The Company will continue to provide the Stock Exchange, from time to time, with information."

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange regarding the highlights of the financial performance under US GAAP which are as follows: The revenues for the quarter stood at USD 196.2 million, up 31.3% on a year-on-year basis and up 6.4% over the previous quarter. The EBITDA for the Company stood at USD 44.6 million, up 46.4% on a year-on-year basis and 5.2% over the previous quarter. The press release issued by the Company regarding the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Disclosure under the SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading)
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that Mr. Ajai Chowdhry, Director of the Company has made the following disclosures regarding the sale of shares of the company:- 1) Mrs Gita Chowdhry (Wife) has on October 08, 2004 sold 1,00,000 shares.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that on October 07, 2004 the company has announced that it has been ranked  as a market leader in META Group's METAspectrumSM report for Offshore Outsourcing. META Group is a leading provider of information technology (IT) research, advisory services and strategic consulting. The press release issued by the Company regarding the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that the company has on October 06, 2004 announced that it has developed an operational risk management and measurement engine, OpRisk Shelter, to identify, measure and manage expected loss related to operational risks of a Bank. With this initiative, the company will be able to further strengthen its presence and offerings in this high potential domain. The press release issued by the Company regarding the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Disclosure under the SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading)
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that Mr. Ajai Chowdhry, Director of the Company had sought and has been granted permission to sell 1,00,000 (One lakh) shares of the Company held by Mrs. Gita Chowdhry, his wife.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: HCL Technologies BPO, the wholly owned business process outsourcing subsidiary of HCL Technologies, has announced that, Invest Northern Ireland (Invest NI) located at Belfast, has sanctioned a grant of GBP 920,000 (GBP Nine Hundred and Twenty Thousand) to their Belfast operations. The press release issued by the Company regarding the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: HCL Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Company has announced that its Insurance Solutions Delivery Center (ISDC) has been recommended for certification under the British Standard (BS) 7799. The press release issued by the Company regarding the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Allotment of shares
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Employees Stock Option Allotment Committee of the Company has on September 28, 2004 allotted 146,492 shares of Rs.2/- each (including 112,522 shares at a premium of Rs.125.50 per share; 400 shares at a premium of Rs.157.50 per share, 1200 shares at a premium of Rs.194.50/- per share, 1100 shares at a premium of Rs.208/- per share, 5000 shares at a premium of Rs.222/- per share and 26270 shares at a premium of Rs.233/- per share) bearing distinctive no(s) 296,332,323 to 296,478,814 to the employees on exercise of their stock options under the 1999 & 2000 Stock Options Plans.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: Hcl Technologies Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Company has announced that HCL Technologies BPO Services, its wholly owned Business Process Outsourcing entity has been awarded the prestigious Customer Operations Performance Centre (COPC) Certification. The details of the press release issued by the Company shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).
